page.title: 04Farming around Colmonell
page.content: Colmonell is in an area of mixed,dairy and hill farming. The village itself has two farms which stand on the main street. Clachanton at the eastern end of the village is a typical mixed farm. It has areas of hill ground used for beef cattle and sheep and lower down on the valley floor areas used for silage and barley production.Clachanton also diversifies by providing a drainage service to local farms. Boghouse,at the western end of the village,is also a mixed farm but they also have a dairy herd in addition to beef cattle and sheep.Like Clachanton Boghouse uses their low lying ground near the river for silage and barley production.
